trans-unit.target: TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_000<tab>Good <var 08 E3E90C0D ((<var 08 E3E90C05 ((evening)) ((morning)) /var>)) ((<var 08 E3E90C12 ((day)) ((evening)) /var>)) /var> to you, my <var 08 E905 ((lady)) ((lord)) /var>. I am the inoshishi doshin, a member of a Far Eastern Delegation come to share our traditions of Heavensturn with the good people of Eorzea. If there is aught you would know of this year's celebration of the boar, you need only ask.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_001<tab>At the turning of the year, a small delegation of our people will journey to Eorzea to herald the coming of Heavensturn, and in so doing, strengthen the bonds of friendship between Eorzea and the Far East.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_002<tab>To mark the occasion, our leader, the inoshishi bugyo, intends to distribute advent cakes, a traditional celebratory treat. Please do try some when you have time. You shall not regret it.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_010<tab>Why, celebrating Heavensturn of course, and thanks to your efforts, my companions and I shall do so unimpeded by the neko bugyo. The inoshishi bugyo has told us of your heroism. We are eternally grateful for all you have done.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_011<tab>That said, so long as we remain here for the festival, there shall be a great need for mochi, that the good people here can partake of our advent cakes. I hope we can count on you to pay another visit to the pounding sites.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_030<tab>At the turning of the year, a small delegation of our people will journey to Eorzea to celebrate the coming of Heavensturn, and in so doing, strengthen the bonds of friendship between Eorzea and the Far East.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_031<tab>To mark the occasion, our leader, the inoshishi bugyo, intends to distribute advent cakes to the people of Limsa Lominsa. Please do go and try some when you have time. You shall not regret it.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_040<tab>You are unfamiliar with this festival? The tradition has a rich history which dates back centuries, but I do not wish to bore you, so I shall try and keep my summation brief.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_041<tab>Heavensturn is a celebration that marks the start of a new year, though the way in which this day is observed differs from region to region. Here in Eorzea, it is said the Twelve select one among them to keep vigil over the realm until the next passing of the twelve moons. I believe this year it is Nald'thal, overseer of the underworld and god of commerce who has been charged with this duty.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_042<tab>In the Far East, however, the changing of the year is heralded by one of twelve totem animals. As you have no doubt discerned from my helm, this year we pay homage to the mighty inoshishi.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_043<tab>Ah, forgive me. That name is likely unfamiliar to your ears. I believe you Eorzeans call this most jovial of beasts a boar. How such a peculiar name was conceived I will never know.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_050<tab>It is how we create our advent cakes, the staple sweet of Heavensturn in the Far East. We first prepare a sizeable portion of steamed rice and place it in a mortar, where it is then pounded into the thick, sticky paste we call mochi.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_051<tab>Though you may find it hard to believe, the pounding of the rice in and of itself is something of a spectacle. But you needn't take my word for it─the mochi daikan is overseeing the mochi pounding as we speak, and would be more than happy to give you a demonstration.

TEXT_FESNYR2019_00442_BOARSERVER_000_052<tab>There is one site in middle La Noscea, southeast of the Zephyr Gate, and another in lower La Noscea, east of the Salt Strand. It is certain to be a treat for your eyes and belly both.
